page.title: 03Modern Day Llandrindod
page.content: height of its popularity in the years 1901-14,it was not uncommon for the town to receive 80,000 visitors annually.After the First World War decline set in,spas became less fashionable and the general economic depression led to a measure of depopulation.It is only since 1974 with local government reorganisation whereby Llandrindod became the county town and with financial assistance from bodies such as the Welsh Development Agency,that there has been rapid expansion. Howey was more important than Llandrindod and was on the main drover and coach route between Brecon and Penybont.Today it is essentially a "dormer" village for its larger neighbour.
